Legal_Issue: Whether Health Canada's rejection of the New Drug Submission (NDS) is reasonable under section C.08.002 of the Food and Drug Regulations
Governing_Law: Food and Drug Regulations, section C.08.002
Application_Facts: Applicant submitted an NDS relying on literature references instead of required clinical trial data
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of Health Canada's decision
Court_Ruling: Health Canada's rejection was reasonable and within its authority
Defendant_Behavior: Health Canada rejected the NDS for non-compliance with regulatory requirements
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged unreasonableness of Health Canada's decision
Assessment_Factor: Sufficiency of information provided in the NDS for assessing safety and efficacy
Applicable_Legislation: Food and Drug Regulations, s. C.08.002; Federal Courts Act, s. 18.1
Procedural_Issue: Application for judicial review under s. 18.1 of the Federal Courts Act
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section C.08.002 of the Food and Drug Regulations
Application_Basis: New Drug Submission lacking clinical trial data
Evidence_Assessed: Absence of clinical trial data in the submission
Relief_Sought: Overturning of Health Canada's rejection decision
Governing_Rule: Section C.08.002 requires sufficient data including clinical trials to assess safety and efficacy
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to include clinical trial data as required by regulation
Outcome: Application dismissed; Health Canada's decision upheld
Cause_Description: Applicant filed an NDS without required clinical trial data, leading to rejection by Health Canada
Evidence_Handling: Health Canada determined the submission did not meet regulatory evidentiary requirements
Legal_Provision_Violated: Section C.08.002 of the Food and Drug Regulations
Evidence_Issues: Submission relied on literature rather than primary clinical trial evidence
Legal_Provision: Section C.08.002, Food and Drug Regulations
Evidence_Assessment: Literature references insufficient to meet regulatory standards for drug approval
Decision_Rationale: Regulation mandates clinical data; applicant failed to provide it; decision was reasonable
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of primary clinical trial data in support of drug safety and efficacy
